ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Is selos in a group a megataunt?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm, I ll have to test this out.  I think that if you are shielded before the mob is engaged, it doesn t count, but my druid always shields me after I ve
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm, I'll have to test this out. I think that if you are shielded before
the mob is engaged, it doesn't count, but my druid always shields me after
I've pulled and it seems to do quite a bit of taunt. But I will check it
out, maybe he is casting something else right away that's doing that. I
know if he casts his dot, there is not a snowball's chance of me taunting
off him.

Tani :)

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Monday, March 27, 2000 10:28 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Is selos in a group a megataunt?


From: <kim@...>

On Mon, 27 Mar 2000, Cranfill, Wendy wrote:
>
> Only advice I have is get a druid to group wtih you. Once they cast that
> damage shield on you, the mobs don't give a FIG about you! They just
start
> pounding the wimpy druid *snicker*.

Damage from a damage shield is unassigned, and as far as I can
tell does not contribute to taunt. If you put a damage shield
on and let an undead beat on you, it'll kill itself and the
corpse will poof.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
